title: Molly Mae spends the night in luxury wedding venue as her family help choose perfect spot
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Click to play Tap to play

Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Molly Mae has spent the night in a stunning country manor wedding venue near Cambridge.

The Love Island star posted an Instagram looking glamorous all in black as she posed at the staircase.

The posh venue is all black with a glistening silver chandelier and black and white checked flooring.

Prices for weddings at Swynford Manor range from £1,000-£6,450 depending on the time of year.

(Image: Instagram)

Molly Mae captioned the photo thanking the venue for her stay.

She wrote: "Lady of the manor. Had the nicest stay at my mums wedding venue".

The venue also posted the photo to its Instagram story, adding: "It was an absolute pleasure having Molly Mae and her family visit us this week.

"Cant wait to see you all soon."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Molly's mother Debbie Gordon got engaged to her partner Jon Rayner while her daughter was in the Love Island villa this summer.

When her mum came in to visit her and meet her boyfriend Tommy Fury, she announced the happy news to Molly Mae, who was delighted.

She exclaimed: "Finally! Finally!"

(Image: ITV)

Recently, Debbie angrily defended her daughter from cruel social media trolls in a video Molly Mae posted.

Molly Mae filmed her mum driving as she sat in the back chuckling away.

Debbie raged: "Podgy knees, fat, put on six stone since leaving the villa.

"Ugly, literally ugly, ugly, small hands, with no brain."

(Image: Instagram)

Meanwhile Molly Mae's relationship with Tommy is also going from strength to strength.

They recently bought a gorgeous penthouse in Manchester together, and on Molly's YouTube channel they announced they wanted to one day have lot of babies.

"We definitely both want children," Molly dished, "But obviously we're both only 20 years old."

(Image: Youtube)

Tommy jokingly chimes in: "We've been trying to make children most nights."

The hunk continues: "Yes we have, we've been snoodling in the bedroom, I want twins by the time I'm 22, simple as that.

"Molly wants six kids, I want eight."
description: Molly Mae's family are helping to choose the perfect wedding venue for her mum Debbie, who got engaged while she was in the villa
